result.execSummary:
The defendant Kent R. Differt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
DNA sample to be provided.  With huber and work release privileges if available.  EMP approved per jail rules.  May serve in Chippewa Co if accepted per jail rules.  To commence on or before 12/28/22.
Consecutive to: any other sentences

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kent R. Differt

records.addlTxt:
2:58 PM Defendant Kent R. Differt in court.  Attorney John Andrew Newton in court for Kent R. Differt.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances noting she's been provided paperwork to indicate a plea agreement.  Atty Newton agrees and notes they have rec'd a copy of the VIS.  Atty Newton enters NC plea to Ct 1.  DE also pleads NC.  Court questions DE on plea.  State states the joint recommendations.  Court discusses huber matter w/counsel off the record.  Back on the record at 3:08 pm.  Court recalls matter and Atty Newton states they are ready to proceed.  Court continues to ask DE re: his plea.  Court accepts plea/finds DE guilty.  State makes statement.  Atty Newton makes statement on behalf of DE.  Victim does not wish to make a statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Ct 1:  NC
7 days jail w/huber and work release privileges if available - consecutive to any other sentences
Two (2) days credit to be applied - to commence on or before 12/28/2022 at 10:00 a.m.
EMP approved per jail rules - May transfer to Chippewa Co if accepted per jail rules
$543.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Cash bond to be applied

01:37 PM Defendant Kent R. Differt in court.  Rick C Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Court notes DE previously waived his right to counsel.  Court notes victim D.D. has filed a petition re: bond modification.  Court notes previously ordered bond conditions.  Victim and DE work at the same place.  Victim is requesting the no contact at the residence provision be dropped.  State is objecting to that being modified.  D.D. makes statement re: counseling, etc.  Court asks questions of D.D.  Court will grant modification to:  No violent/abusive or harmful physical contact w/D.L.D. which would apply at home and at work.  Court reminds DE of upcoming court dates.
Hearing on February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:05 PM Defendant Kent R. Differt in court.  Emily Eklund appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  DE states he doesn't want counsel at this time.  Court asks that the DE fill out a written waiver of attorney form and she'll recall the matter.  Back on the record, the Court questions DE on the written waiver of counsel.  Court accepts waiver of counsel.  Court reminds DE of upcoming hearings/dates/times.
Hearing on February 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

03:35 PM Defendant Kent R. Differt in court.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $150.00 CASH bond continues w/additional Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/D.L.D. solely at residence. No violent orabusive contact w/D.L.D. at place of employment.   May retrieve your belongings if accompanied by a law enforcement officer upon prior notice, one time.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
